result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan De La Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work. with credit for 4 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.
- No attending FISERV Forum while on probation.
- Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

- AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatments.
- Absolute sobriety with random testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan De La Cruz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan De La Cruz in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Jonathan De La Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed but not acted upon. Judge Conen spun plea/sentencing hearing to Judge Dee which accepted.

Defendant Jonathan De La Cruz in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Jonathan De La Cruz.  Attorney Nate McClure in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case called.  Case passed to allow court to hear another case.  Case recalled.  Appearances remain the same.  Plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 37 for Branch 13 proceeded.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements, offer letter and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 120 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work. with credit for 4 days time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 9 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatments
- maintain work and school
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- anger management classes
- no attending FISERV Forum while on probation

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment. 

Appeal rights given
*
Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Jonathan De La Cruz in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requests additional time to review plea paperwork with defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan De La Cruz in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan De La Cruz appeared by video means with Attorney.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan De La Cruz in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense in receipt of offer but has not received discovery and requests an additional status to allow time to receive discovery and review. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jonathan De La Cruz in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Jonathan De La Cruz in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan De La Cruz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jonathan De La Cruz

Prior: 6304 North Oakley Avenue #3, Chicago, IL 60659
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
